connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from a JMS Queue or Topic using plain JMS 2.x API.

camel.source.path.destinationType.name: camel.source.path.destinationType
camel.source.path.destinationType.description: The kind of destination to use One of: [queue] [topic]

camel.source.path.destinationName.name: camel.source.path.destinationName
camel.source.path.destinationName.description: DestinationName is a JMS queue or topic name. By default, the destinationName is interpreted as a queue name.

camel.source.endpoint.acknowledgementMod.name: camel.source.endpoint.acknowledgementMode
camel.source.endpoint.acknowledgementMod.description: The JMS acknowledgement name, which is one of: SESSION_TRANSACTED, CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE, AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE, DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE One of: [SESSION_TRANSACTED] [CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE] [AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE] [DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE]

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.consumerCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerCount
camel.source.endpoint.consumerCount.description: Sets the number of consumer listeners used for this endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.durableSubscriptio.name: camel.source.endpoint.durableSubscriptionId
camel.source.endpoint.durableSubscriptio.description: Sets the durable subscription Id required for durable topics.

camel.source.endpoint.reconnectBackOff.name: camel.source.endpoint.reconnectBackOff
camel.source.endpoint.reconnectBackOff.description: Backoff in millis on consumer pool reconnection attempts

camel.source.endpoint.reconnectOnError.name: camel.source.endpoint.reconnectOnError
camel.source.endpoint.reconnectOnError.description: Try to apply reconnection logic on consumer pool

camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionId.name: camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionId
camel.source.endpoint.subscriptionId.description: Sets the subscription Id, required for durable or shared topics.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.messageSelector.name: camel.source.endpoint.messageSelector
camel.source.endpoint.messageSelector.description: Sets the JMS Message selector syntax.

camel.source.endpoint.asyncStartListener.name: camel.source.endpoint.asyncStartListener
camel.source.endpoint.asyncStartListener.description: Whether to startup the consumer message listener asynchronously, when starting a route. For example if a JmsConsumer cannot get a connection to a remote JMS broker, then it may block while retrying and/or failover. This will cause Camel to block while starting routes. By setting this option to true, you will let routes startup, while the JmsConsumer connects to the JMS broker using a dedicated thread in asynchronous mode. If this option is used, then beware that if the connection could not be established, then an exception is logged at WARN level, and the consumer will not be able to receive messages; You can then restart the route to retry.

camel.source.endpoint.asyncStopListener.name: camel.source.endpoint.asyncStopListener
camel.source.endpoint.asyncStopListener.description: Whether to stop the consumer message listener asynchronously, when stopping a route.

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.connectionCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionCount
camel.source.endpoint.connectionCount.description: The maximum number of connections available to this endpoint

camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory
camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory.description: Initializes the connectionFactory for the endpoint, which takes precedence over the component's connectionFactory, if any

camel.source.endpoint.connectionResource.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionResource
camel.source.endpoint.connectionResource.description: Initializes the connectionResource for the endpoint, which takes precedence over the component's connectionResource, if any

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionListener.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionListener
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionListener.description: Specifies the JMS Exception Listener that is to be notified of any underlying JMS exceptions.

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.source.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProp.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProperties
camel.source.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProp.description: Whether to include all JMSXxxx properties when mapping from JMS to Camel Message. Setting this to true will include properties such as JMSXAppID, and JMSXUserID etc. Note: If you are using a custom headerFilterStrategy then this option does not apply.

camel.source.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrate.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides two implementations out of the box: default and passthrough. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). The passthrough strategy leaves the key as is. Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the # notation.

camel.source.endpoint.mapJmsMessage.name: camel.source.endpoint.mapJmsMessage
camel.source.endpoint.mapJmsMessage.description: Specifies whether Camel should auto map the received JMS message to a suited payload type, such as javax.jms.TextMessage to a String etc. See section about how mapping works below for more details.

camel.source.endpoint.messageCreatedStra.name: camel.source.endpoint.messageCreatedStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.messageCreatedStra.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLoggin.name: camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLoggin.description: Allows to configure the default errorHandler logging level for logging uncaught exceptions. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLogSta.name: camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLogStackTrace
camel.source.endpoint.errorHandlerLogSta.description: Allows to control whether stacktraces should be logged or not, by the default errorHandler.

camel.source.endpoint.transacted.name: camel.source.endpoint.transacted
camel.source.endpoint.transacted.description: Specifies whether to use transacted mode

camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchCo.name: camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchCount
camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchCo.description: If transacted sets the number of messages to process before committing a transaction.

camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchTi.name: camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.transactionBatchTi.description: Sets timeout (in millis) for batch transactions, the value should be 1000 or higher.

camel.source.endpoint.sharedJMSSession.name: camel.source.endpoint.sharedJMSSession
camel.source.endpoint.sharedJMSSession.description: Specifies whether to share JMS session with other SJMS endpoints. Turn this off if your route is accessing to multiple JMS providers. If you need transaction against multiple JMS providers, use jms component to leverage XA transaction.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionCount.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionCount
camel.component.sjms2.connectionCount.description: The maximum number of connections available to endpoints started under this component

camel.component.sjms2.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.sjms2.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.sjms2.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.sjms2.reconnectBackOff.name: camel.component.sjms2.reconnectBackOff
camel.component.sjms2.reconnectBackOff.description: Backoff in millis on consumer pool reconnection attempts

camel.component.sjms2.reconnectOnError.name: camel.component.sjms2.reconnectOnError
camel.component.sjms2.reconnectOnError.description: Try to apply reconnection logic on consumer pool

camel.component.sjms2.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.component.sjms2.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.sjms2.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.sjms2.connectionClientId.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionClientId
camel.component.sjms2.connectionClientId.description: The client ID to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionFactory.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionFactory
camel.component.sjms2.connectionFactory.description: A ConnectionFactory is required to enable the SjmsComponent. It can be set directly or set set as part of a ConnectionResource.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionMaxWait.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionMaxWait
camel.component.sjms2.connectionMaxWait.description: The max wait time in millis to block and wait on free connection when the pool is exhausted when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionResource.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionResource
camel.component.sjms2.connectionResource.description: A ConnectionResource is an interface that allows for customization and container control of the ConnectionFactory. See Plugable Connection Resource Management for further details.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionTestOnBo.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionTestOnBorrow
camel.component.sjms2.connectionTestOnBo.description: When using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource then should each javax.jms.Connection be tested (calling start) before returned from the pool.

camel.component.sjms2.jmsKeyFormatStrate.name: camel.component.sjms2.jmsKeyFormatStrategy
camel.component.sjms2.jmsKeyFormatStrate.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides one implementation out of the box: default. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the # notation.

camel.component.sjms2.messageCreatedStra.name: camel.component.sjms2.messageCreatedStrategy
camel.component.sjms2.messageCreatedStra.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

camel.component.sjms2.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.component.sjms2.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.sjms2.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionPassword.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionPassword
camel.component.sjms2.connectionPassword.description: The password to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms2.connectionUsername.name: camel.component.sjms2.connectionUsername
camel.component.sjms2.connectionUsername.description: The username to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms2.transactionCommitS.name: camel.component.sjms2.transactionCommitStrategy
camel.component.sjms2.transactionCommitS.description: To configure which kind of commit strategy to use. Camel provides two implementations out of the box, default and batch.
